Articles.Content: I built an ugly, heavy, and stupid plane. Called it the FHWS-MK II, for F@%# Huge Wing Span-Mark 2.
I specialize in getting bored and then starting a new save. I don't think I've had any saves last a week.

What I specialize in?

Well, I can build lifters to get me to Duna based on guesswork

Same to any planet

And Kerbol "escape"
I don't know about specialize, but my favorite things to build are bases and stations. The satisfaction of seeing all the parts come together just the way you want them is great.

Thats simple...

SSTO space planes.

http://hodo.imgur.com/

My specialty is big things. REALLY big things. And sending them to other planets.

And the required heavy lifting, of course

I generally tend to build complex things - and try to build them to perfection. Doing something is nice, but I often want to make sure I did the absolute best I could do.

Nowadays I spend most of my time with kOS. I have spent the past months perfecting a script that does just one thing It has to be robust, as universal as possible and prevent user error where it can.

Impressively overengineered launch stages. My best so far was a 1336 ton rocket that could get a 137t lander(included in the 1336t) onto Duna, Ike, and back again (and still have over 2k dV in the tanks)

My speciality?

making death traps called SSTO aircraft... (can never get flight dynamics correct... or fuel loads)

All my kerbals want to go on my rockets instead of the aircraft...

at least the rockets have a 50% chance of working
Using my Super Heavy Lift 500ton-to-LKO Launch Vehicle to launch 5 ton probes.
My speciality is getting to the Mun and back. Because that is all I can do. Period.
Hey, getting to the Mun and back is something.

I build space stations and space station accessories.

(also normal ships with an ASYMMETRICAL LAYOUT WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAT)

I think mine would be getting everything I build to work first try with no problems.. Rockets, planes, rovers and whatnot.. I even built a craft back in an older version with only one of every part and landed it on the Mun, then returned all in my first attempt
My specialty would making small complex probes and sending them to other planets. Sadly i only bother doing that every kerbal year...

My specialty is racing rovers. I make a mean racing rover.

So mean that it might offend you or your friends if you drive it well enough.

That's not in my control. I apologise on my rovers' behalf.
I make quite the impressive bonfires on the launchpad...
Stranding Kerbals
Not packing enough fuel...
Warships!
I love building lifters that look really nice and get the job done, I also like building probes with the AIES Aerospace mod.
Warships. Win.

Warships!

^

l

Or rovers.

Planes are pretty cool. Especially by Lockheed Martin.

Aesthetic changes have occurred since these photos to the sr-72. All aspects are now improved, and it is much more sleeker for stealth along with capability for mid air re fueling.

Tanker prototype in progress.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Javascript is disabled. View full album

Space Planes! Especially SSTOs.

Also, designing tons of missions and then rarely completing them before the next version of KSP makes them obsolete or untenable.
